solution_line_template: In the first {pumping_hours} hours, the milk tanker got {pumping_hours} hours * {pumping_rate} gallons/hour = <<{pumping_hours}*{pumping_rate}={pumped_milk}>>{pumped_milk} gallons
Thus, the storage tank was left with {initial_milk} gallons - {pumped_milk} gallons = <<{initial_milk}-{pumped_milk}={remaining_after_pumping}>>{remaining_after_pumping} gallons.
For the next {adding_hours} hrs, the workers added {adding_rate} gallons/hour * {adding_hours} hours = <<{adding_rate}*{adding_hours}={added_milk}>>{added_milk} gallons
The total therefore is {remaining_after_pumping} gallons + {added_milk} gallons = <<{remaining_after_pumping}+{added_milk}={final_milk_in_tank}>>{final_milk_in_tank} gallons
